pages.text: I hate this land. It sucks. It's hot and dry and empty and I hate it. Another thing I hate is writing a stupid diary, but my memories have been fading lately and I want to remember every passing day. I need to remember what happened before everything went downhill. I often times think back to before all this. I think about the smiles on my

wife's face. The pure joy that my kids had when we would go out to the beach. It's becoming harder and harder for me to remember all the good things I used to have when my current life is shadowed with sadness and sorrow. Right now, I'm sitting in the shade of one of my new companions. I call them monstruos. Mainly because they scare people away, but also because I don't know

what else I would call a cactus that moves and follows me around. It's only been about 3 months since the incident but I'm still shaken by the events that took place. Just thinking about it gives me the sweats, also this heat but I think my body is getting used to it as time goes on. Yesterday those darn bounty hunters were back for more. As if they didn't get a big enough piece of me last time.

Sitting here thinking about them makes me think about all the horrible things that they did to me. The torture, the pain... the pain was the worst of it all. Not the physical pain, but the pain I felt every time they would threaten my family, but that is a tale for another entry, I don't want to think about that right now. I want to remember my beautiful family the way they were before all this. My
wonderful Carlita and my kids Nancy and Hector. If you ever see this, I am so sorry for everything.
